agency.compaction-keep-size.description: keep as many indices before compaction point

agency.compaction-step-size.description: step size between state machine compactions

agency.disaster-recovery-id.description: allows for specification of the id for this agent; dangerous option for disaster recover only!

agency.election-timeout-max.description: maximum timeout before an agent calls for new election [s]

agency.election-timeout-min.description: minimum timeout before an agent calls for new election [s]

agency.max-append-size.description: maximum size of appendEntries document (# log entries)

agency.my-address.description: which address to advertise to the outside

agency.supervision-grace-period.description: supervision time, after which a server is considered to have failed [s]

agency.wait-for-sync.description: wait for hard disk syncs on every persistence call (required in production)

cluster.create-waits-for-sync-replicatio.description: active coordinator will wait for all replicas to create collection

cluster.index-create-timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) the coordinator will wait for an index to be created before giving up

cluster.require-persisted-id.description: if set to true, then the instance will only start if a UUID file is found in the database on startup. Setting this option will make sure the instance is started using an already existing database directory and not a new one. For the first start, the UUID file must either be created manually or the option must be set to false for the initial startup

cluster.synchronous-replication-timeout-.description: all synchronous replication timeouts are multiplied by this factor
all synchronous replication timeouts are increased by this amount per 4096 bytes (in seconds)

compaction.db-sleep-time.description: sleep interval between two compaction runs (in s)

compaction.dead-documents-threshold.description: minimum unused count of documents in a datafile

compaction.dead-size-percent-threshold.description: how many percent of the source datafile should be unused at least

compaction.dead-size-threshold.description: how many bytes of the source data file are allowed to be unused at most

compaction.max-file-size-factor.description: how large the resulting file may be in comparison to the collections '--database.maximal-journal-size' setting

compaction.max-files.description: Maximum number of files to merge to one file

compaction.max-result-file-size.description: how large may the compaction result file become (in bytes)

compaction.min-interval.description: minimum sleep time between two compaction runs (in s)

compaction.min-small-data-file-size.description: minimal filesize threshhold original data files have to be below for a compaction

daemon.description: background the server, running it as daemon

database.auto-upgrade.description: perform a database upgrade if necessary

database.check-30-revisions.description: check _rev values in collections created before 3.1

database.check-version.description: checks the versions of the database and exit

database.force-sync-properties.description: force syncing of collection properties to disk, will use waitForSync value of collection when turned off

database.ignore-datafile-errors.description: load collections even if datafiles may contain errors

database.maximal-journal-size.description: default maximal journal size, can be overwritten when creating a collection

database.required-directory-state.description: required state of database directory at startup (non-existing: database directory must not exist, existing: database directory must exist, empty: database directory must exist but be empty, populated: database directory must exist and contain specific files already, any: any state allowed)

database.restore-admin.description: resets the admin users and sets a new password

database.throw-collection-not-loaded-err.description: throw an error when accessing a collection that is still loading

database.wait-for-sync.description: default wait-for-sync behavior, can be overwritten when creating a collection

define.description: define key=value for a @key@ entry in config file

dump-options.description: dump configuration options in JSON format

foxx.queues-poll-interval.description: poll interval (in seconds) for Foxx queue manager

frontend.proxy-request-check.description: enable or disable proxy request checking

frontend.trusted-proxy.description: list of proxies to trust (may be IP or network). Make sure --frontend.proxy-request-check is enabled

frontend.version-check.description: alert the user if new versions are available

gid.description: switch to group-id after reading config files

http.allow-method-override.description: allow HTTP method override using special headers

http.hide-product-header.description: do not expose "Server: ArangoDB" header in HTTP responses

http.trusted-origin.description: trusted origin URLs for CORS requests with credentials

javascript.allow-admin-execute.description: for testing purposes allow '_admin/execute', NEVER enable on production

javascript.enabled.description: enable or disable the V8 JS engine entirely

javascript.gc-frequency.description: JavaScript time-based garbage collection frequency (each x seconds)

javascript.gc-interval.description: JavaScript request-based garbage collection interval (each x requests)

javascript.startup-directory.description: path to the directory containing JavaScript startup scripts

javascript.v8-contexts.description: maximum number of V8 contexts that are created for executing JavaScript actions

javascript.v8-contexts-max-age.description: maximum age for each V8 context (in seconds) before it is disposed

javascript.v8-contexts-max-invocations.description: maximum number of invocations for each V8 context before it is disposed

javascript.v8-contexts-minimum.description: minimum number of V8 contexts that keep available for executing JavaScript actions

ldap.prefix.description: ldap prefix, eg. uid= xor dn= xor cn=

ldap.refresh-rate.description: Refresh user settings after this time (in seconds)

ldap.roles-attribute-name.description: ldap attributename where the role are located.

ldap.roles-exclude.description: Regexp to exclude groups. Leave empty to exclude none.

ldap.roles-include.description: Regexp to include groups. Leave empty to include all.

ldap.roles-search.description: ldap search for roles; '{USER}' is replaced by the 'dn' of the user.

ldap.roles-transformation.description: Regexp to normalizer role name, e.g. '/^ *(.*[^ ]])*/$2/'

ldap.search-scope.description: ldap search scope, one of base, one, sub

ldap.tls-cert-check-strategy.description: ldap tls cert check strategy, one of never, hard, demand, allow, try

log.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.force-direct.description: do not start a seperate thread for logging

log.foreground-tty.description: also log to tty if backgrounded

log.keep-logrotate.description: keep the old log file after receiving a sighup

log.level.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.line-number.description: append line number and file name

log.prefix.description: prefix log message with this string

log.shorten-filenames.description: shorten filenames in log output (use with --log.line-number)

log.thread.description: show thread identifier in log message

log.thread-name.description: show thread name in log message

log.use-local-time.description: use local timezone instead of UTC

nonce.size.description: the size of the hash array for nonces

query.cache-entries.description: maximum number of results in query result cache per database

query.cache-mode.description: mode for the AQL query result cache (on, off, demand)

query.fail-on-warning.description: whether AQL queries should fail with errors even for recoverable warnings

query.memory-limit.description: memory threshold for AQL queries (in bytes)

query.slow-threshold.description: threshold for slow AQL queries (in seconds)

query.tracking.description: whether to track slow AQL queries

query.tracking-with-bindvars.description: whether to track bind vars with AQL queries

random.generator.description: random number generator to use (1 = MERSENNE, 2 = RANDOM, 3 = URANDOM, 4 = COMBINED (not for Windows), 5 = WinCrypt (Windows only)

replication.auto-start.description: switch to enable or disable the automatic start of replication appliers

rocksdb.block-cache-shard-bits.description: number of shard bits to use for block cache (use -1 for default value)

rocksdb.block-cache-size.description: size of block cache in bytes

rocksdb.compaction-read-ahead-size.description: if non-zero, we perform bigger reads when doing compaction. If you're running RocksDB on spinning disks, you should set this to at least 2MB. that way RocksDB's compaction is doing sequential instead of random reads.

rocksdb.delayed_write_rate.description: limited write rate to DB (in bytes per second) if we are writing to the last mem-table allowed and we allow more than 3 mem-tables, or if we have surpassed a certain number of level-0 files and need to slowdown writes

rocksdb.dynamic-level-bytes.description: if true, determine the number of bytes for each level dynamically to minimize space amplification

rocksdb.enable-pipelined-write.description: if true, use a two stage write queue for WAL writes and memtable writes

rocksdb.enable-statistics.description: whether or not RocksDB statistics should be turned on

rocksdb.encryption-key-generator.description: program providing the encryption key on stdout. If set, encryption will be enabled.

rocksdb.encryption-keyfile.description: file containing encryption key. If set, encryption will be enabled.

rocksdb.intermediate-commit-count.description: an intermediate commit will be performed automatically when this number of operations is reached in a transaction

rocksdb.intermediate-commit-size.description: an intermediate commit will be performed automatically when a transaction has accumulated operations of this size (in bytes)

rocksdb.level0-compaction-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a compaction

rocksdb.level0-slowdown-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a write slowdown

rocksdb.level0-stop-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a full write stall

rocksdb.max-background-jobs.description: Maximum number of concurrent background jobs (compactions and flushes)

rocksdb.max-bytes-for-level-base.description: if not using dynamic level sizes, this controls the maximum total data size for level-1

rocksdb.max-bytes-for-level-multiplier.description: if not using dynamic level sizes, the maximum number of bytes for level L can be calculated as  max-bytes-for-level-base * (max-bytes-for-level-multiplier ^ (L-1))

rocksdb.max-subcompactions.description: maximum number of concurrent subjobs for a background compaction

rocksdb.max-total-wal-size.description: maximum total size of WAL files that will force flush stale column families

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number.description: maximum number of write buffers that built up in memory

rocksdb.min-write-buffer-number-to-merge.description: minimum number of write buffers that will be merged together before writing to storage

rocksdb.num-levels.description: number of levels for the database

rocksdb.num-threads-priority-high.description: number of threads for high priority operations (e.g. flush)

rocksdb.num-threads-priority-low.description: number of threads for low priority operations (e.g. compaction)

rocksdb.num-uncompressed-levels.description: number of uncompressed levels for the database

rocksdb.optimize-filters-for-hits.description: this flag specifies that the implementation should optimize the filters mainly for cases where keys are found rather than also optimize for keys missed. This would be used in cases where the application knows that there are very few misses or the performance in the case of misses is not important

rocksdb.recycle-log-file-num.description: number of log files to keep around for recycling

rocksdb.table-block-size.description: approximate size (in bytes) of user data packed per block

rocksdb.transaction-lock-timeout.description: If positive, specifies the wait timeout in milliseconds when  a transaction attempts to lock a document. A negative value is not recommended as it can lead to deadlocks (0 = no waiting, < 0 no timeout)

rocksdb.use-direct-io-for-flush-and-comp.description: use O_DIRECT for flush and compaction

rocksdb.use-fsync.description: issue an fsync when writing to disk (set to true for issuing fdatasync only)

rocksdb.wal-directory.description: optional path to the RocksDB WAL directory. If not set, the WAL directory will be located inside the regular data directory

rocksdb.wal-file-timeout.description: timeout after which unused WAL files are deleted

rocksdb.wal-recovery-skip-corrupted.description: skip corrupted records in WAL recovery

rocksdb.write-buffer-size.description: amount of data to build up in memory before converting to a sorted on-disk file (0 = disabled)

server.allow-use-database.description: allow change of database in REST actions, only needed for unittests

server.authentication.description: enable or disable authentication for ALL client requests

server.authentication-system-only.description: use HTTP authentication only for requests to /_api and /_admin

server.authentication-timeout.description: timeout for the authentication cache in seconds (0 = indefinitely)

server.authentication-unix-sockets.description: authentication for requests via UNIX domain sockets

server.check-max-memory-mappings.description: check the maximum number of memory mappings at runtime

server.descriptors-minimum.description: minimum number of file descriptors needed to start

server.gid.description: switch to group-id after reading config files

server.jwt-secret.description: secret to use when doing jwt authentication

server.local-authentication.description: enable or disable authentication using the local user database

server.maximal-queue-size.description: maximum queue length for pending operations (use 0 for unrestricted)

server.session-timeout.description: timeout of web interface server sessions (in seconds)

server.statistics.description: turn statistics gathering on or off

server.uid.description: switch to user-id after reading config files

ssl.cafile.description: ca file used for secure connections

ssl.cipher-list.description: ssl ciphers to use, see OpenSSL documentation

ssl.ecdh-curve.description: SSL ECDH Curve, see the output of "openssl ecparam -list_curves"

ssl.options.description: ssl connection options, see OpenSSL documentation

ssl.protocol.description: ssl protocol (1 = SSLv2, 2 = SSLv2 or SSLv3 (negotiated), 3 = SSLv3, 4 = TLSv1, 5 = TLSv1.2)

ssl.require-peer-certificate.description: require a peer certificate when connecting

ssl.session-cache.description: enable the session cache for connections

supervisor.description: background the server, starts a supervisor

uid.description: switch to user-id after reading config files

vst.maxsize.description: maximal size (in bytes) for a VelocyPack chunk

wal.allow-oversize-entries.description: allow entries that are bigger than '--wal.logfile-size'

wal.historic-logfiles.description: maximum number of historic logfiles to keep after collection

wal.ignore-logfile-errors.description: ignore logfile errors. this will read recoverable data from corrupted logfiles but ignore any unrecoverable data

wal.ignore-recovery-errors.description: continue recovery even if re-applying operations fails

wal.open-logfiles.description: maximum number of parallel open logfiles

wal.reserve-logfiles.description: maximum number of reserve logfiles to maintain

wal.slots.description: number of logfile slots to use

wal.sync-interval.description: interval for automatic, non-requested disk syncs (in milliseconds)

wal.throttle-wait.description: maximum wait time per operation when write-throttled (in milliseconds)

wal.throttle-when-pending.description: throttle writes when at least this many operations are waiting for collection (set to 0 to deactivate write-throttling)

wal.use-mlock.description: mlock WAL logfiles in memory (may require elevated privileges or limits)
